text:
Native valve endocarditis due to Pseudallescheria boydii in a patient with AIDS: case report and review.
 A 53-year-old man with AIDS developed mitral valve endocarditis due to infection with the fungus Pseudallescheria boydii.
 A limited number of cases of prosthetic valve endocarditis caused by this organism have been described.
 We report a unique case of pseudallescheria infection of a native valve and describe this disease in a patient with AIDS.
